clinical_study.brief_title: Estimate the Effect of the Photo-activated Disinfection on the Root Canal Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: Acess the Clinical Effect of Photodynamic Therapy(PDT) in the Root Canal Disinfection.

brief_summary.textblock: This study tries to collect clinical cases to compare the clinical effect of traditional root canal disinfection, to photodynamic in root canal disinfection .And provide the reference for clinical application and experience.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study of groups:
Group1:2%Sodium hypochlorite ultrasonic irrigation+17%EDTA Group2:2%Sodium hypochlorite ultrasonic irrigation+17%EDTA+PDT Group3:1%Sodium hypochlorite ultrasonic irrigation+17%EDTA+PDT Microbiological measurement. Filled with sterile PBS, the root canals were sampled immediately before and after the disinfection procedures.

arm_group.description: Rubber dam isolation，tooth disinfection ，acess to the pulp of the chamber ,microbiological sample with two sterile paper points #20,then Mechanical preparation with NITIMTWO to 25#06 ,then use the kerr files hand instrument enlarger the apical to #40,and cleaned with 5 ml of 2.0% NaOCl between each endodontic file. At the end of the procedure, root canals were ultrasonic irrigated with 2% NaOCl ,17% ethylene diamine tetra-acetic acid (EDTA) for 1 min followed by irrigation with 0.9% normal saline to remove the smear layer ,then take the sample again,then drying the canal ,warm vertical condensation +AH-PLUS pasta,ZOE to seal the crown cavity ,one week later ,take crown restoration .Follow up at 1,7days ,3, 6,12 and 24 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Adequate health ,with no systemic conditions;cooperative behavior;tooth with single root canal;a diagnosis of chronic periapical periodontitis;the lesions of the root tip was less than 6mm,recently (3months)did not take antibiotics.
Exclusion Criteria:
Systemic condition,uncooperative behavior; periodontal-endodontic lesions;Allergic to photosensitizer;the root apical absorption or destroy;A root canal anatomy of risk factors for the difficulty score ≧ 2
